baseline_groups.claim_summary: Price elasticity of cement demand is negative: higher prices reduce quantity shipped, estimated via OLS with market FE on log-log specification.
baseline_groups.notes: Cement application baseline. OLS with market FE, no controls, clustered by EPA market. Spec iv/method/ols is an exact duplicate of baseline (identical coefficient, SE, and all fields).

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Price elasticity of airline demand is negative: higher ticket prices reduce market share (nested logit), estimated with route FE and product controls.
baseline_groups.notes: Airlines application baseline. Nested logit demand model with market (route-quarter) FE, product-level controls (direct, HUB, miles, airline FE), clustered by route. Separate dataset and model structure from cement.

global_notes: Methods paper with two empirical applications (cement and airlines). Key issues: (1) iv/method/ols duplicates baseline exactly; (2) LOO controls for cement start from the full-controls model, not the no-controls baseline; (3) quadratic spec reports linear term of quadratic, not comparable to elasticity; (4) direct_only and connecting_only change from nested to simple logit, altering model structure; (5) some IV specs (cpi_ng_price, cpi_wage_hr) have weak first stages producing sign reversals.
